summary: Completed testing of bug fixes for Team Dashboard, Position Group Averages, Wellness Colors, Decimal Input, and QTRGauge. Fixed a critical bug in backend (injury_risk boolean validation). All 6 backend tests pass. Frontend UI verified working.

fixed_during_testing.issue: injury_risk field was returning None instead of boolean when fatigue_score was None
fixed_during_testing.fix: Changed `(fatigue_score and fatigue_score > 70)` to `(fatigue_score is not None and fatigue_score > 70)`

seed_data_creation: Test athletes created and cleaned up during testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: All bug fixes verified working. Backend tests in /app/backend/tests/test_team_dashboard_bugs.py cover position_summary structure, session counting, position group averages, wellness data, and decimal velocity input.

position_summary_structure.details: position_summary contains all required fields: count, avg_acwr, avg_wellness, avg_fatigue, avg_distance, avg_sprints, avg_max_speed, high_risk_count

position_group_averages.details: Position groups show GROUP AVERAGES (avg_distance, avg_sprints, avg_max_speed) calculated correctly across multiple athletes in same position

session_counting.details: Session counting correctly counts unique session_name + date combinations, not individual GPS periods

wellness_colors.details: WellnessCharts uses getValueColor function with inverted logic for fatigue/stress/pain (low=green, high=red)

decimal_velocity_input.details: VBT and strength assessment forms accept decimal input for velocity fields (m/s). Tested with 0.85 m/s successfully

qtr_gauge_component.details: QTRGauge component has proper height/viewBox calculations (containerHeight = size * 0.85) to prevent cut-off
